headline: Phoenician's Key Lime Pie
description: Ground toasted almonds spike the crust of this delicious Key lime pie.
name: Phoenician's Key Lime Pie

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Make crust: Pulse almonds in a food processor until finely ground, then pour into a medium bowl. Add graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and salt. Pour in melted butter and mix until evenly moistened. Press into a 9-inch pie plate.
Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown, 10 to 13 minutes.

While crust is baking, make filling: Beat condensed milk, cream, egg yolks, and lime zest in a large bowl until well combined. Whisk in lime juice, a little at a time, to thicken custard. Pour custard into pie crust.
Bake until custard is set, about 15 minutes. Cool to room temperature on a wire rack, then cover loosely with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 8 hours to overnight.

review.reviewBody: This is my favorite pie recipe that I have been using for years!!!
I made this for Father's Day, and it was a BIG hit with the whole family. In fact, they let me know it's going to be expected at least once a year now.

This key lime pie is ridiculously good! We followed the recipe and used Nellie and Joe's Key West Lime Juice. It turned out perfect and was really quite easy to make. I think we put in too many almonds because we measured them after they were ground so next time we will fix that. Still it is fantastic! I will take this to summer parties when invited. Way to go Arlette!!

I like this recipe because it used egg yolks and is more stable. It will hold refrigerated for 3-5 days. I replaced some of the liquid with sour cream. I like the tang as I do the same in my cheesecakes.

Amazing! I made a small change to it. Did pistachios instead of almonds and only did 1/4 cups gram crackers and the rest nuts. Amazing change and flavor that compliments the limes. Also used a spring pan instead of a pie plate.
So incredibly easy!!! Absolutely delicious.

This was good. First time making a key lime pie. I gave it 4 stars just because it needed to be a little firmer. It kind of sunk a little while cutting into it, But the taste was great. The leftovers settled in more then the first following morning after being in fridge overnight. The crust was great! I did add food coloring to give it some color. I’ll try this again

This will be my go-to key lime pie recipe. The crust, with the toasted ground almonds, was to die for. It added a fabulous dimension to the flavors of this pie. I was concerned that the crust was too dry to hold together when serving, but I was wrong. It held together beautifully.
Fantastic! Super easy! need to plan 24 hours, needs to set overnight.

I did make this but I added 4 oz of cream cheese. Just make sure it is blended well before adding the milk ingredients and eggs,( cream cheese will be clumpy if not well blended). Makes for a great light tasting key lime cheese cake.
Excellent!! Well received by company. I used actual key limes and juiced them myself.? Smooth creamy and delicious. The mouth feel is almost like chocolate.?

Thank you so much for this recipe. I had a can of sweetened condensed milk I needed to use and decided to try making a Key Lime Pie. Having never made one before I searched around for a recipe and found that most used 2 cans of sweetened condensed milk which I didn't have. I came across this recipe and it was perfection! It was the perfect combination of sweet and tart and I think the other recipes I was looking at would have been way too sweet. I sprinkled the lime zest on top of the cooled and set pie before serving rather than mixing it in. I used regular limes and added in some meyers lemon juice as many reviews recommended. This pie is "company" worthy.
This is great. I won't make it again because all key lime pie is great and this adds a number of steps. I usually make it because it is so easy and this recipe makes it not as easy.

Wonderful! I have been looking for things to adapt to my 6-inch tart pans and this worked wonderfully. I made a half of this recipe and that filled 6 small tart shells perfectly. I used about 3/4 the recommended bake times because of the smaller sizes. I'll definitely be making these again.
delicious, but kinda messy to eat.
Great recipe...regular limes work too. Make the crust, it's easy and makes all the difference.

We make this for any and every occasion almost. It’s my 7 year olds favorite desert as well as mine. I vary the nuts and even the ratio to graham crackers along with throwing in a cracker variation when possible (coconut cookies, lemon...). It’s always a bit different and delicious every time. A for sure crowd pleaser!
Fabulous! Made according to recipe with no tweaks. My 18 year old son has now listed this as his favorite dessert of all times and has requested it become a staple of our Thanksgiving menu each year.
This is the best Key Lime pie I have ever made. The crust is now my "go to" crust. I used the crust in many other pies.

love to read reviews but don't often comment but this recipe is a keeper--exactly as it is. You might want to know that "key lime" are the same as the little Mexican limes. Was searching for key limes in the store and only found the Mexican limes not realizing they were the same. DELICIOUS!

This is very good but the consensus was that the almonds in the crust overwhelmed the flavor of the limes. I would make a plain graham cracker crust next time. This was great frozen - it doesn’t get too hard and is so refreshing on a hot summer day.
Made the pie exactly as the recipe stated! Came out great! I did make home made whip cream to go with it!

I added 1T of regular lime zest. I like it very lime-ey. To the crust I also added 1/2 c of toasted coconut. Chopped all in the food processor fine and add enough melted butter to make “wet sand” mixture. I then used 4-6 oz ramekins. Packed 1/4 cup of crust mixture in each ramekin & baked for 10-15 min @ 350°. I then filled each ramekin with equal amounts of custard mixture and baked for an additional 15min @ 350°. Pulled them, let cool for a few min then covered and refrigerated. Garnished with whipped cream and lime zest or curls.
Amazing! Not too much lime but also not too sweet, great!

Amazing! Rave reviews at my mom's birthday party! I had never made a key lime pie today but this from scratch recipe was easy and seems to be fail proof. My only deviation from the recipe was omitting the almonds from the crust simply because I did not have any. Everyone loved it. Great texture, just the right amount of lime, perfect crust.

This is my go to recipe for Key Lime Pie. I've been making it for years and it never disappoints! I don't usually do almonds in the crust (just being lazy I guess) and just increase the graham crackers. I also don't do lime zest and it is still a phenomenal pie!!! Perfect creamy texture and a lime taste that isn't too sweet, too sour or overpowering. 5 starts for sure!!!! Thank you for sharing this recipe!
Awesome! Nuff said
Wife and son love this Key Lime Pie so I keep making it.

"It was better than the one in the Florida Keys, and the ones in the Key's are delicious!"

Mom
Absolutely awesome!! This is now a family favorite!!

This is a great recipe but I made a few changes because I love the taste of lime and possibly due to my having to use regular limes instead of key limes. I used 3/4 cup of lime juice, 3/4 teaspoon of grated lime zest and added 3-4 drops of concentrated lime oil for the filling. I then sprinkled another 3/4 teaspoon of grated lime zest on top of the filling, before baking, for decoration.

Once baked I prepared whipped cream - added 3/4 drops of the lime oil to the whipping cream and sugar.

Absolutely delicious! This will be my new go-to Key Lime Pie recipe. My DIL, when I told her what I was making for dessert, said only my son would eat it, not her or the kids. Well guess what? Everyone loved it!! Made as directed except I added more lime zest. Can't wait to have it again!
Loved this recipe. My family's from Florida so we had plenty of different versions of Key Lime Pie. This is the best I've had so far.
Delicious! Best key lime pie ever!
I read the other reviews and added a touch more lime zest - it's absolutely perfect!!
Yup! This was as delicious as everyone said. My husband and I ate literally 2/3 the pie last night.

I've made this pie many times since I first found it, several years ago. Its flavor is great, the recipe is foolproof (good for us "follow the recipe" types), and the ingredients are easily obtained. The only differences in how I make it: I use whole almonds, and I make half again as much of everything for a "full sized" pie.
Hubby declared it perfect! Nice texture, great crust. I would have liked it a little more tart :

We had farm fresh eggs, ripe limes, and no cream....so we used plain Zoi yogurt!
Times were good for crust, but we needed an extra six minutes for filling to set up.
The smell is lovely and the taste is delightful!
Followed the recipe exactly except I used a Keebler Graham Cracker Pie crust and I added crushed almond into the bottom of the Pie Crust and then added the filling.
Amazing key lime pie. This is the best key lime pie I have ever tasted, and......I made it. Thanks so much for the recipe. It was a big hit at the party.
We added more lime juice and zest to make it tart and topped it with homemade whipped cream also made with lime zest. It was delicious!
This is the perfect key lime pie recipe. Even the non-dessert eater had a piece and loved it'
while it turned out well, not as easy as other recipes a little too tangy for my taste

This is just my first time to comment. 
This is always a flawless dessert! I have used this recipe for several years and made it countless times for cook outs and other gatherings. I usually make two at a time. I double the recipe but start with store-bought graham cracker crusts. I use the left over egg whites and brush the crusts and bake at 375 for 5-8 min. I know you're asking about the almond flavor, but hold on...
I use the zest from a whole lime. Be sure it is ripe/dark green all the way around. I then drop a cup (+/-) of sliced almonds in the mix since the flavor is not in the crust. This method allows for all the flavors of the original with an easier clean up.

I made this for our southern thanksgiving and it’s the best key lime pie recipe I’ve Ever tried!! I’ve made variations of this in the past but this is our new favorite! I toasted almond slivers in butter myself before grinding them and adding crust mixture and they added a supurb nutty flavor to the crust that is perfect with the tart key lime flavor. I could not get fresh key limes so used bottled and it was still delicious! I definitely would not sub anything for the heavy cream which balances the tart key lime juice.
I love this pie! I just got some fresh key limes from my dad's front yard and wanted to make a pie out of them. This recipe is perfect. Didn't change a thing and it came out delicious!
Added an extra cup of milk; heaping tablespoon garlic, leftover onion and mushrooms, and saved 1/2 c cheddar to sprinkle on top. Also added 1/2 c Italian breadcrumbs under the cheese topping.
Got rave reviews from all that ate it. I made it with almond flour and through all the crust ingredients in a food processor then patted it into a pie pan.

This pie has a rich, creamy custard filling. One of the creamiest custard pies I’ve ever had. It is very sweet with more of a custard flavor and subtle on the lime. I baked it several minutes longer than suggested and it still took a full 24hrs for it to set up enough to cut. I’m not a graham cracker crust fan so I used a different type of crust, adding ground almonds to the crust. It made for a lovely pie.

Made it as written, well, my husband did... And I topped it with whipped cream, homemade, and sliced strawberries tossed with a little bit of sugar. SO good. It was my 27th birthday pie :) Very lovely. Would make (or have husband make!) again!
A big hit

I followed the recipe except didn't have time to make the almond crust. I used a ready made graham cracker crust and after baking for 10 min. placed approx. 1/4 cup roasted chopped almonds in bottom of crust before adding filling. I used heavy whipping cream and increased the lime zest to 1 tsp. I only had time to refrigerate for an hour before serving---and it was perfect. Everyone enjoyed the pie. It is a keeper.

Wow! Great texture & flavor on a delicious crust. I followed this recipe exactly EXCEPT I used regular limes instead of key lines. I bet this would be outta this world this those, but this was pretty darn good with regular lines.

I made this exactally how the recipe says except I used regular limes instead of key limes as we don't get them where I live. It's excellent. The first time I made it I put whipped cream on the top but it's way better without.
Loved it! My family wants me to make it again. It was so easy.
Made the first one and our family loved it. I added 1 Tbs more of keylime juice and doubled the zest. Perfect.

I have been wanting to make this pie forever. Yesterday I got a chance to make it for my Memorial day dinner. I loved the idea of putting nuts in the crust. I decided to put my own spin on it by crushing Lorna Doone cookies and macadamia nuts. I also made the recipe 50% bigger, because I had an extra large pie pan. I baked the pie for 25 minutes instead of 15 to make up for the size difference. This pie was exceptional! I will be making it again.

Perfection. My first time ever making key lime pie for my husband who is from Florida ( I’m from CA) The crust was unbelievable, loved the texture. The pie was literally the best I’ve ever eaten, even in Key West. Even though it said to refrigerate overnight, we couldn’t wait, and after 5 hours we cut it up and it was phenomenal! We both had two servings. Keeping this recipe to make for my mother-in-law!

This was sublime. I’m a key lime pie fan, and this is the best I’ve ever had...several of my guests said the same. Followed the recipe for the filling, but substituted coconut cookie crumbs and omitted the sugar from the crust. Worked perfectly.
Love Love Love it. Great Key Lime pie!!!!!
This pie was easy to make and as good, if not better than any I’ve eaten in the best restaurants. My family and guests LOVED it. I will make it often!

This is my far the best key lime pie I have ever eaten. I lived in Florida and have had the pleasure of eating Key West key lime pie, in my opinion, this is even more delicious. The nuts added to the crust help make this extra special. I have experimented with different type nuts in the crust, they all seem to work well. I would recommend this recipe go in your “go to” list of favorites.

This was my first time making Key Lime pie so I didn't know quite what to expect. I chose this recipe since it had the most "fresh" ingredients listed, and followed it exactly - easy! Wow - everyone was so impressed and a number of key lime lovers thought this was the BEST pie ever! Thank you so much for sharing this recipe with us!
Loved it. Found "Nellie & Joe's Famous Key West Lime Juice" at our local grocery store and used that, so no lime zest, but good anyway. Easy to make. No more store-bought key lime pie for us.
This is my favorite Key Lime Pie. I make each year on Feb 4th. It’s our anniversary and we were married in Key West so we had wedding pie instead of cake.

This key lime pie was the first I’ve ever made but it was easy and the filling turned out perfectly. Tart and slightly sweet. I’ll definitely make it again. My only hitch was I required more butter in the crust as it wasn’t staying together. But with the extra 1/4 cup butter it was perfect and the crust was amazing and worth toasting the almonds for for sure.
Best Key Lime Pie EVER. I receive compliments every time I make this pie for special occasions.
A couple of years later and it's still the most requested contribution to my family potlucks. Absolutely heavenly.
Not amazing but it was very good.
Followed the recipe exactly, but added some lime and vanilla abstract for extra flavor

This was great and easy to make. I made a couple of substitutions for my own palette - I generally find recipes from the US and Canada too sweet, so I took out the sugar in the base entirely, and replaced it with a little over 1/2 cup of coconut shavings instead. I used creme fraiche instead of "heavy" cream (which I took to read double cream). The cake set well and tasted delicious.
Kudos to Arlette for posting this recipe on the All Recipes site. I had made this for an event recently and everyone raved about how delicious it was. Hats off to the Chef!

Hello Everyone and thank you so much for your sweet comments and likes. I am having a problem correct one mistake in the recipe , trying since some time for some reason I cannot do that. For the lime zest it should be 1 tablespoon and not tsp. sorry about the typo. The zest with the rest of ingredients complete the flavour.
Arlette - Phoenician Gourmet

Didn't care for it. I made it exactly as the recipe directed. It was overly lime and sweet. The crust was overdone and it tasted almost burnt. It didn't have the creamy consistency I have tasted with other recipes.

I made a little variation and everybody loved it. I added a meringue on top.
To Make Meringue: In a large glass or metal mixing bowl, beat the remaining egg whites until foamy (that you can turn the bowl upside down and it doesn't fall). Gradually add sugar, continuing to beat until whites form stiff peaks. add few drops of ppepermint extract and keep beating. Spread meringue over pie covering completely.
hope you like it!!!!
This crust is SOOOOOO delicious!! Filling is yummy too, but I think it's the crust that makes this key lime pie extra special!

This is the first time I have made key lime pie, and I have to say, it was one of the best I have had. I made 2 for a family BBQ, and everyone started remembering the first time they ever tried a key lime pie in Florida. Like other people have said, don't change and thing. Easy recipe to follow, and comes out amazing...I will definitely make this again.
The almonds in the crust sets this recipe apart.
This turned out perfectly. Best key lime pie recipe so far
Very good, especially the crust. I used almond flour which is all ground almond anyway.
I helped my wife make it and it came out outstanding! Im not one for the lemon or lime taste but this was thee best I've had.
I have been looking for a very long time for the perfect key lime pie recipe and this is it. I have made it several times without modification and it has been perfect every time!
Delicious - followed recipe exactly and it turned out great. Will definitely make it again and again!
Husband said it was the best he's had. I thought the results were fantastic considering how easy the recipe is
I used vanilla gram crackers instead of honey grams. That is the only thing that I changed. It was fabulous and truly the best Key Lime Pie ever.
Excellent.
Great. Lighter than the regular key lime pie. Is nice in any type of pie crust.

Other reviewers all loved this crust, but I had a lot of trouble with it. The toasted almonds were a delicious addition, but the crust was so crumbly it feel apart, and I had to rebake it. Then, the custard was absorbed into the crust, and some of the crust floated upwards, and baked on top. The final result did taste good, but there was too much crust for too little filling. If I'd make this again, I'd add more butter to the crust and double the filling.
This recipe is perfect a is.

Best key lime pie I've ever had! No tweaks or substitutions needed, although I will note that I used regular grocery store limes, and one time had to supplement with Rose's sweet lime juice to get a full 1/2 cup and it tasted equally good. Enjoy!

The crust is the BEST! The almonds really add a nice effect and keep the crust from ever getting soggy. The 2nd time I made this I upped the amount of key lime juice a bit and squeezed in the lime juice from the "regular" lime that I used for zest. Everyone raved. Doubling the recipe fills a 9x13 pan nicely.

The crust is the BEST! The almonds really add a nice effect and keep the crust from ever getting soggy. The 2nd time I made this I upped the amount of key lime juice a bit and squeezed in the lime juice from the "regular" lime that I used for zest. Everyone raved. Doubling the recipe fills a 9x13 pan nicely.
I have made this pie at least three times and everyone LOVES it!
The custard was very good and delicious but I ran into a issue when I put the butter into the almonds and crumbs it was very powdery so I had to add more butter ethier way it came out great
I bake this all the time...my husband is from south Florida and says it's better than his grandmothers pies...????
This has to be the best Key Lime Pie I have ever made. Everybody I have made it for says it is the best. I have made no changes in the recipe.

Being my first Key Lime Pie to ever make or taste, I must say this was excellent and so easy to make. The taste was Magnificent from the crust to the filling! I made a tiny change by adding 1/2 sweetened condensed milk and 1/2 cup cream, instead of the 3/4 cup cream it called for, in addition to the 1 can of sweetened condensed milk. I used a 1/2 cup more butter for the crust than the recipe called for as I used 14 graham crackers instead of the almonds I probably won't look for another key lime pie recipe. It's a Keeper.

I prepared two of these for a board meeting last night. Hands Down... absolutely everyone said it was the Best Key Lime they've ever eaten. The only thing I did different was to brush the crust with whipped egg whites before baking. Phenomenal recipe for sure! Thank You.
